title: Astronauts prep to install new solar array outside International Space Station
summary: NASA astronauts Josh Cassada and Frank Rubio will put on their spacesuits Saturday and head outside the International Space Station for a spacewalk to install and unfurl a new roll-out solar array recently delivered by a SpaceX cargo ship.

title: Space Force establishes component at U.S. Central Command
summary: U.S. Central Command on Dec. 2 activated a Space Force component known as U.S. Space Forces-Central

title: NASA Sets Coverage of Orion’s Historic Moon Mission Return, Splashdown
summary: NASA will provide live coverage of the Artemis I uncrewed Orion spacecraft’s return flyby of the Moon on Monday, Dec. 5, as well as its return to Earth on Sunday, Dec. 11.

title: RS-25 engine performance “perfect” on Artemis I debut launch
summary: The four RS-25 engines from Aerojet Rocketdyne successfully propelled the Core Stage, Interim Cryogenic Propulsion System, and Orion/Service Module stack into its initial Earth orbit during the system’s debut launch on Nov. 16, 2022.

title: After bankruptcy and war, OneWeb turns to a competitor for help
summary: OneWeb, as ever, is doing what it needs to do to survive.

title: OneWeb aims to deploy a record 40 satellites in SpaceX mission
summary: OneWeb said SpaceX is slated to launch 40 of its satellites as early as Dec. 6 to complete almost 80% of its low Earth orbit broadband constellation.

title: Astra chief engineer resigns, CEO shakes up management ‘to execute faster’
summary: Beleaguered rocket builder Astra is losing its highly touted chief engineer, Benjamin Lyon, the company disclosed in a securities filing Friday.

title: Rocket Report: SpaceX launch delayed indefinitely; Virgin Orbit cancels funding round
summary: "Due to current market conditions, the company has elected not to proceed."

title: FCC grants partial approval for Starlink second-generation constellation
summary: The FCC has partially approved SpaceX’s application for the second generation of its Starlink constellation, allowing the company to launch up to a quarter of the proposed 30,000 satellites while deferring action on the rest.

title: Orion begins return leg of Artemis 1 mission
summary: NASA’s Orion spacecraft started its trip back to Earth Dec. 1 with the first of two maneuvers that will put the spacecraft on course for a splashdown in the Pacific Ocean in a week and a half.
